title: A Worcester woman has been missing since leaving work Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Joanna Brown, 30, from Worcester, has been missing since leaving work at Bean Counter Bakery Cafe on Friday morning.
She is described as 5-foot-6, with hazel eyes, and may be driving a 2025 Gray Mitsubishi Outlander.
Police believe she might be in the Holyoke or Springfield areas; information can be reported to Worcester Police at 508-799-8606.

title: ‘Clapgate’: Mike Vrabel responded to Falcons’ accusations of Patriots’ illegal clapping
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismissed Atlanta Falcons accusations that the Patriots simulated a snap with clapping, affecting a critical play.
Following a stellar performance, DeMario Douglas played despite personal tragedy, having learned of his uncle's death before the game.
Vrabel is participating in Movember for men's health, with a focus on prostate cancer awareness amid a coaching staff diagnosis.

title: Lululemon shoplifting spree continues in Boston
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Lululemon store at 776 Boylston St. was targeted by shoplifters on Sunday around 6:53 p.m.
This incident marks the third shoplifting spree at Lululemon's Boston locations in just over a month.
Boston police are investigating the incidents and ask for public assistance to identify the suspects.

title: Two Red Sox outfielders earn Gold Glove Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox outfielders Wilyer Abreu and Ceddanne Rafaela win 2025 Gold Glove Awards for right field and centerfield.
Abreu wins his second consecutive Gold Glove despite being limited to 115 games; led A.L. right fielders in Outs Above Average.
Rafaela leads A.L. centerfielders with 21 Outs Above Average to secure his first Gold Glove victory.

title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: James Black, Mt. Blue Middle School principal, criticized for wearing ICE officer costume with bulletproof vest for Halloween.
Superintendent Christian Elkington confirmed investigation; costume incident occurred off school grounds with no school activity connection.
Advocacy group Project Relief Maine criticized the costume as insensitive to immigrant students' safety and fear of ICE.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Christian Gonzalez cleared concussion protocol after head injury in fourth quarter against Atlanta Falcons.
Gonzalez's injury occurred covering Drake London's 40-yard catch, London's longest of nine receptions totaling 118 yards.
New England Patriots won the game by one point after Falcons missed extra point, marking closest win of the season.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End volunteers collected nearly 180 needles in six days from Southwest Corridor Park, highlighting public safety concerns.
City Councilor Ed Flynn emphasizes zero tolerance for open drug use and calls for increased resources for needle pick-up.
Boston distributes over 81,000 needles monthly for harm reduction, a figure Flynn suggests is excessive and needs reduction.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant compares Jayson Tatum's Achilles rehab to his own, noting Tatum's advanced recovery progress.
Tatum, six months post-injury, impresses Durant by already dunking; hopes for a possible late-season return.
Tatum's return could shift Celtics' expectations; Durant admires Tatum's commitment and anticipates his comeback.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas posted his first 100-yard NFL game, contributing to the Patriots' 24-23 win over the Falcons.
Terrell Jennings scored his first NFL touchdown, stepping in for injured Rhamondre Stevenson with 35 yards on 11 attempts.
Both players, childhood friends from Jacksonville, played through personal grief following the death of a close family friend.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots narrowly defeated the Falcons 24-23 at Gillette Stadium despite various turnovers and defensive challenges.
Mike Vrabel encouraged the team to embrace joy and resilience after the hard-fought victory against Atlanta.
Quarterback Drake Maye threw for 259 yards and two touchdowns but committed two turnovers leading to Atlanta points.
